item.title: mantra-mAtRkA-bhAShaNam
item.description:
shabda-brahma-darshana

  • Basic Sastra on Sabda Brahma Darśana - vākyapadīyam. This tells us how the world came into being as per Vyakaraṇa Darśana.
  • Śabdabrahma is Cetana and Source of all.

अनादिनिधनं ब्रह्म
शब्दतत्त्वं यदक्षरम्।
विवर्ततेऽर्थभावेन
प्रकृया जगतो यतः॥

  • The use of grammatically correct word only is Dharma (that way you connect to shabda-brahma). Impure Apabhraṁśa word also gives meaning; however, its use is Adharma.

Sanskrit phonetic alphabet is very scientific - wrt sthAna, prayatna etc. progression.

item.title: Ranga on mantras
item.description:
Source: TW

A note on mantras. There was an offline conversation with an acquaintance regarding whether mantras should be kept secret or be open sourced for anyone to open and study. While, obviously the outcome was a stalemate, one thing became clear - It’s actually hard to define a mantra. While an H has an intuitive grasp of what it is, describing it is another story. I was reflecting on this briefly.
